job_title: Greater Chicago Fulfillment Center - Digital Team Internship
job_description: <p style="text-align:left"><b>Job Location</b></p>CINCINNATI GENERAL OFFICES<p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:left"><b>Job Description</b></p><p>P&G is the largest consumer packaged goods company in the world. We have operations in over 75 countries, with 65 trusted brands that improve lives for 5 billion consumers worldwide. This brings many advantages, including the opportunity for our employees to enjoy a diverse and rewarding lifelong career filled with new and exciting challenges. We give you the tools to become a world class leader!</p><p></p><p>P&G is recognized as one of the Top Companies for Executive Women, Fast Company Best Workplace for Innovators, and as one of the Most Reputable Companies by both Forbes and Fortune.</p><p></p><p>How would you like to spend your summer on a dynamic team supporting warehouse automation, build digital tools, and work on continuous improvement projects? A Supply Chain Internship will give you the opportunity to tremendous impacts on our supply chain end-to-end.</p><p></p><p>We want engineers and data experts who can handle dynamic work environments and who know how to think outside the box! We rely on our Supply Chain Interns to add fresh perspective to our supply chain that will impact our business for years to come!</p><p></p><p>Your summer is bound to be lively, and you will have opportunities to interact with senior leadership, network with fellow interns and new hires, and grow relationships in and outside of work! Depending on your final placement, you will have the opportunity to work on projects in our Warehouses, customer teams and end to end supply chain systems.<span> </span><b>SNO Internships start in late May and end in early August, lasting 12 weeks.</b></p><p></p><p>There are a variety of responsibilities you could have as SNO Summer Intern, here are a few examples:</p><ul><li><p>o Identifying, prioritizing, analyzing, and eliminating losses and inefficiencies</p><p>o Implement dashboards to improve Mixing Center efficiency and improve productivity</p><p>o Build visualizations for site flow, capacity planning and other business solutions.</p><p>o Track active initiatives and their health status.</p><p>o Support P&G’s Corporate Citizenship priorities, such as Equality & Inclusion, Sustainability, and community impact.</p></li></ul><p></p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:left"><b>Job Qualifications</b></p><div><b>What We are Looking for:</b></div><div><div><div><div><p></p><p>Working towards a Bachelor’s or Master’s in Supply Chain <span>Management/Logistics,</span> Industrial Engineering, Other Business Administration or Engineering, Computer Science, Mathematics.</p><ul><li><b>Excellent visionary, strategic and courageous leadership skills</b></li><li>Problem solving via innovation & creativity</li><li>Strong <span>thinking/problem-solving</span> skills which can be applied to business processes with a "can-do" attitude</li><li>Ability to collaborate effectively within a multicultural environment</li></ul><p></p><p><b>Just So You Know:</b></p><p></p><p>We are committed to providing equal opportunities in employment. We value diversity and do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.</p><p></p><h2>Starting Pay / Salary Range: $29-50/hr</h2><p></p><p>Compensation for roles at P&G varies depending on a wide array of non-discriminatory factors including but not limited to the specific office location, role, degree/credentials, relevant skill set, and level of relevant experience. At P&G compensation decisions are dependent on the facts and circumstances of each case. Total rewards at P&G include salary + bonus (if applicable) + benefits.</p><p></p><p>Your recruiter may be able to share more about our total rewards offerings and the specific salary range for the relevant location(s) during the hiring process.</p><p></p><p>All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, age, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, marital status, citizenship, HIV/AIDS status or any other legally protected factor.</p><p></p><p>Immigration Sponsorship is not available for this role. For more information regarding who is eligible for hire at P&G along with other work authorization FAQ’s, please click<span> </span><a href="https://faq.pgwebtools.com/us-work-authorization-faqs/" target="_blank">HERE</a>.</p><p></p><p>Procter & Gamble participates in e-verify as required by law.</p><p></p><p>Qualified individuals will not be disadvantaged based on being unemployed.</p></div></div></div></div><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:left"><b>Job Schedule</b></p>Full time<p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:left"><b>Job Number</b></p>R000144604<p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:left"><b>Job Segmentation</b></p>Internships<p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:left"><b>Starting Pay / Salary Range</b></p>$29.00 - $50.00 / hour

Job Description Summary

The Taylor Morrison Internship Program is open to students who are enrolled in an accredited college, university, or technical school. You must be at least 18 years of age to be eligible for this internship. Interns will have the opportunity to learn more about Taylor Morrison’s core values, how they drive everything we do and take an active part of the magical experience called new home building.

So…. What are you waiting for? Submit your application to join us in an adventure you will never forget and an opportunity to be part of making dreams come true for others. Taylor Morrison is a top builder dedicated to building quality homes and communities. We are looking for individuals who have a passion for top-tier customer service and for professional growth. If you are looking for an experience where you can learn, grow, develop your skills, have fun, then this is the place for you to be Explorer!

Job Details

What You’ll Learn & Do

Sales Interns

  • Exposure to typical real-estate related activities including the ins and outs of buying, selling, and building the American Dream. Gain vital hands-on experience in this fast-paced, competitive field from attending sales rallies and model showings. Throughout the course of this internship, you’ll prepare market analyses, conduct research, assist with community openings, create marketing collateral to include web content, and update listings.

Skills/Competencies

  • resilience
  • growth mindset
  • customer centric
  • personal responsibility

Sound Like You?

You might be just who we’re looking for if you have…

  • High School Diploma/GED and enrolled in an accredited college or university or technical school
  • Proficiency in all Microsoft Office Applications as well as have savvy computer skills
  • Strong communication skills both oral and written as well as strong in organization skills
  • Customer service-oriented mindset and believe customer is number one priority
  • Understanding of the need to be flexible and prioritize tasks to meet deadlines

FLSA Status: Non-Exempt

  • This position is considered a non-exempt position for purposes of wage-hour law, which means that you will be required to keep a time record and will be eligible for overtime pay.

Essential Functions:

Successful job applicants will be able to perform these functions. Reasonable accommodation will be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

  • Report to Division/Corporate Office/Community daily and adhere to schedule
  • Ability to access, input, and retrieve information from a computer and/or electronic device
  • Ability to have face to face conversations with customers, co-workers and higher-level manager
  • Ability to sit or stand for long periods of time and move around work environment as needed
  • Ability to operate a motor vehicle if applicable
  • Comply with company policies and procedure

Physical Demands:

  • Must be able to able to remain in a stationary position up to 50% of the time
  • The ability to frequently lift and/or move up to 10 pounds and occasionally lift and/or move up to 25 pounds

*Taylor Morrison experience and/or successful completion of training program may override required education and/or experience requirement.

Job descriptions are not intended as, nor should be construed to be, exhaustive lists of all responsibilities, skills, efforts, or working conditions associated with a job. They are intended to be accurate reflections of those principal job duties and responsibilities essential for making fair pay decisions about the job.

Taylor Morrison is an equal opportunity employer. Taylor Morrison does not discriminate against any candidate or employee on the basis of race, national origin, sex, marital status, sexual orientation, age, disability, religion or veteran status.

Taylor Morrison Homes does not provide Visa sponsorship.

<p style="text-align:left"><b><i><span>Welcome to Warner Bros. Discovery… the stuff dreams are made of.</span></i></b></p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:left"><b><span>Who We Are… </span></b></p><p style="text-align:left"><span>When we say, “the stuff dreams are made of,” we’re not just referring to the world of wizards, dragons and superheroes, or even to the wonders of Planet Earth. Behind WBD’s vast portfolio of iconic content and beloved brands, are the <i>storytellers</i> bringing our characters to life, the<i> creators</i> bringing them to your living rooms and the <i>dreamers</i> creating what’s next…</span></p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:left"><span>From brilliant creatives, to technology trailblazers, across the globe, WBD offers career defining opportunities, thoughtfully curated benefits, and the tools to explore and grow into your best selves. Here you are supported, here you are celebrated, here you can thrive.</span></p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:left">We are the now and the next. The power behind the people building the future. We are born from the spirit of innovation. We are created from the idea that people around the world want more, need more, deserve more. We are the home of the global digital revolution. We are CNN.</p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:left"><span>To see what it’s like to work at CNN, follow @WBDLife on </span><a target="_blank" href="http://instagram.com/wbdlife">Instagram</a><span> and </span><a target="_blank" href="http://twitter.com/wbdlife">X</a><span>!</span></p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p><b>CNN International Internships: ATL - Summer 2026</b></p><div><p><span> </span></p></div><div><p><b><span>Application Deadline:</span><span><span> </span></span><span>Sunday</span><span>,<span> </span></span><span>February 22</span></b><b><span>nd</span></b><b><span>*</span></b><span> </span></p></div><div><p><b><span>*</span><span>Pro Tip:<span> </span></span><span>S</span><span>ubmit</span><span><span> </span></span><span>your application as soon as possible – applications could close earlier due to applicant<span> </span></span><span>volume!*</span></b><span> </span></p></div><div><div><p><span> </span></p></div><div><p><span> </span></p></div><div><p><b><span>Your New Role </span></b><span><span> </span></span><span> </span></p></div><div><p><span><span>We have multiple CNN International internship opportunities available. By applying to this posting, you will be<span> </span></span><span>considered for</span><span><span> </span></span><span>multiple<span> </span></span><span>internship opportunities within this</span><span><span> </span>general</span><span><span> </span>area.<span> </span></span><span>These internships will be located in the ATL area.</span><span><span> </span>The selected interns will be expected to join us in the office on a regular<span> </span></span><span>cadence</span><span><span> </span>based on the intern<span> </span></span><span>manager</span><span>’</span><span>s</span><span><span> </span>in office schedule.</span></span><span> </span></p></div><div><p><span> </span></p></div><div><p><span><span>Example internship opportunities<span> </span></span><span>could include</span><span>:</span></span><span> </span></p></div><div><ul><li><p>CNN International Newsroom Intern</p></li><li><p>CNN International Planning Intern</p></li><li><p>CNN International Productions Intern</p></li><li><p>CNN Global Productions Intern</p></li></ul></div><div><p><span> </span></p></div><div><p><b><span>Your Role Accountabilities</span></b><span> </span></p></div></div><div><div><p><span><span>Duties could include:</span></span><span> </span></p><ul><li><p>Work with a team that produces, writes, and creates original pieces for broadcast and online audiences</p></li><li><p>Work with the International Content Unit to write scripts for air, including packages</p></li><li><p>Attend editorial meetings and liaise with CNN International show teams</p></li><li><p>Work closely with our Associate Producers to assist with cutting videos and soundbites</p></li><li><p>Contact prospective guests for live shows</p></li><li><p>Handle logistics for guest bookings</p></li><li><p>Learn template-based graphic skills</p></li><li><p>Conduct research and pre-interviews for use in show segments</p></li><li><p>Make clips of interviews after they air</p></li><li><p>Learn about the technology and systems used in news and features production for digital, television, and social content</p></li><li><p>Research, pitch, plan, and put together stories, segments, and programs on topics like travel, business, African culture, conservation, innovation, etc.</p></li></ul></div><div><p><span> </span></p></div><div><p><b><span>Qualifications & Experience</span></b><span> </span></p></div><div><ul><li><p><b>Please include link(s) to your portfolio, writing samples and/or demo reel that showcase your writing skills and/or video editing skills. </b></p></li><li><p><b>Cover letter required. Please submit your cover letter along with your resume as one PDF. </b></p></li><li><p>Must have a keen interest in current events and international affairs and be invested in international news</p></li><li><p>Strong communication and writing skills</p></li><li><p>Must show initiative and ask questions</p></li><li><p>Knowledge of video editing software</p></li><li><p>Keen interest in telling engaging stories to a global audience</p></li><li><p>Strong understanding of international cultures and trends</p></li><li><p>Awareness of basic editing, shooting and production skills</p></li><li><p>A great attitude and willingness to learn</p></li><li><p>Journalism major or journalism experience</p></li><li><p>Additional language skills is a plus</p></li></ul></div><div><ul><li><p><span><span>Must be actively enrolled in a</span><span>n</span><span><span> </span>accredited college or university degree program for the full duration of the internship (proof of enrollment<span> </span></span><span>required</span><span>) </span></span><span> </span></p></li></ul></div><div><ul><li><p><span><span>Must be a rising <b>Junior or </b></span><b><span>Senior</span></b><span><span> </span>(18 years or older) </span></span><span> </span></p></li></ul></div><div><ul><li><p><span><span>Must be in academic good standing (3.0 or above GPA)</span><span><span> </span></span><span>A transcript</span><span><span> </span>will be<span> </span></span><span>required</span><span><span> </span>to verify your GPA if an offer is extended.</span></span><span> </span></p></li></ul></div><div><ul><li><p><span><span>Warner Bros. Discovery will only consider candidates who are presently authorized to work for any employer in the United States and who will not require work visa sponsorship from Warner B</span></span><span><span>ros. Discovery now or in the future<span> </span></span><span>in order to</span><span><span> </span></span><span>retain</span><span><span> </span>their authorization to work in the United States. Candidates currently on any student or exchange visa, including F-1 CPT, F-1 OPT, J-1, M-1, etc., will not be eligible for the internship program.</span></span><span> </span></p></li></ul></div><div><p><span> </span></p></div><div><p><span> </span></p></div><div><p><b><span>What to know before applying:</span></b><span> </span></p></div><div><ul><li><p><span><span>The duration of the program is 11</span><span><span> </span>weeks </span></span><span> </span></p></li></ul></div><div><ul><li><p><span><span>Program dates:</span> </span></p></li></ul></div><div><ul><li><p><span><span>Option 1: June<span> </span>1st</span></span><span><span> </span><span><span> </span>–</span><span><span> </span>August 1</span><span>4</span></span><span><span>th</span></span><span><span> </span> </span></p></li></ul></div><div><div><div><ul><li><p><span><span>Option 2: June<span> </span>8th</span></span><span><span><span> </span>– August 2</span><span>1</span></span><span><span>st</span></span><span><span> </span> </span></p></li></ul></div></div><div><div><ul><li><p><span><span>Interns will be expected to work<span> </span></span><span>35-40</span><span><span> </span>hours per week in a<span> </span></span></span><b><span>hybrid capacity</span></b><span> </span></p></li></ul></div><div><ul><li><p><span><span>Our internships are paid opportunities with a competitive hourly wage. Credit is not<span> </span></span><span>required</span><span>; however, we will provide the necessary documentation for school credit if desired. Relocation is not provided. </span></span><span> </span></p></li></ul></div><div><ul><li><p><span><span>Interviewing will take place from<span> </span></span><span>mid February</span><span> </span><span><span> </span>through<span> </span></span><span>early-</span><span>April</span><span>. A WBD team member will contact you if your experiences and interests match an open internship position. Due to the high volume of applications, we are unable to give individual status updates.</span></span><span> </span></p></li></ul></div><div><p><span> </span></p></div><div><p><span> <span>On December 5, Netflix and Warner Bros. Discovery announced they have entered into a definitive agreement under which Netflix will acquire Warner Bros., including its film and television studios, HBO Max and HBO.</span><span><span> </span>The transaction is expected to close after the separation of Warner Bros. Discovery's Global Networks division, Discovery Global, into a new<span> </span></span><span>publicly-traded</span><span><span> </span>company, which is expected to be completed in Q3 2026. For more details, including leadership appointments and information on individual brands, please visit our newsroom </span></span><a href="https://nam11.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.wbd.com%2Fnews%2Fwarner-bros-discovery-announces-post-separation-company-names-and-leadership-appointments&data=05%7C02%7CJessica.Loftus%40wbd.com%7Cfb80e6d529694aecf09b08de5f804a51%7C0eb48825e8714459bc72d0ecd68f1f39%7C0%7C0%7C639053201763773855%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJFbXB0eU1hcGkiOnRydWUsIlYiOiIwLjAuMDAwMCIsIlAiOiJXaW4zMiIsIkFOIjoiTWFpbCIsIldUIjoyfQ%3D%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=FYdLkE9V1V0HkYTxngzLDZuh5JyvGpysQaCzfdSFQxk%3D&reserved=0" target="_blank"><span><span>here</span></span></a><span><span>.</span></span><span> </span></p></div><div><p><span> </span></p></div><div><p><span><span>Although you will be hired by Warner Bros. Discovery, upon the planned spin-off of Discovery Global in 2026, your employment<span> </span></span><span>likely will</span><span> transition to Warner Bros. (or) transition to Discovery Global. During this period of transformation,<span> </span></span><span>you’ll</span><span><span> </span>have an exciting opportunity to lay the foundation at one of the world’s premier entertainment brands.</span></span><span> </span></p></div></div><p></p><p></p></div></div><div><div><p><b><span>About Our Internship Program</span></b><span> </span></p></div><div><p><span><span>WBD's Internship Program is designed to nurture students professionally and personally. We attract the country’s boldest and brightest students for<span> </span></span><span>paid,</span><span><span> </span>for-credit, real-world internship experiences in the entertainment, tech, sports,<span> </span></span><span>news</span><span><span> </span>and media industries. We offer career-defining opportunities to learn valuable skills that will help you prepare for a successful future. </span></span><span> </span></p></div><div><p><span> </span></p><p></p></div><div><p><b><span>Ready to learn more?<span> </span></span><span>Here’s</span><span><span> </span>what we offer:</span></b><span> </span></p></div><div><ul><li><p><span><span>Hands-on work with passionate, talented team members in your field</span></span><span> </span></p></li></ul></div><div><ul><li><p><span><span>Mentorship from some of the industry’s kindest and most passionate entertainment veterans</span></span><span> </span></p></li></ul></div><div><ul><li><p><span><span>Engaging events including professional development seminars, panels with recruiters and former interns, intern-exclusive events, and so much more </span></span><span> </span></p></li></ul></div><div><ul><li><p><span><span>Access to top-level executives and employees through our Speaker Series and Roundtables</span></span><span> </span></p></li></ul></div><div><ul><li><p><span><span>Incredible networking opportunities with industry-leading professionals and a robust intern alumni network</span></span><span> </span></p></li></ul></div><div><ul><li><p><span><span>A creative, collaborative, and inclusive company culture </span></span><span> </span></p></li></ul></div><div><p><span> </span></p><p></p></div><div><p><b><span>What you can expect to take away from the semester:</span></b><span> </span></p></div><div><ul><li><p><span><span>Opportunities to develop professionally and uncover skills you<span> </span></span><span>didn’t</span><span><span> </span>know you had</span></span><span> </span></p></li></ul></div><div><ul><li><p><span><span>The insider scoop on the entertainment industry and what happens behind the scenes</span></span><span> </span></p></li></ul></div><div><ul><li><p><span><span>Relationships that will go beyond your collegiate career</span></span><span> </span></p></li></ul></div><div><ul><li><p><span><span>Real-life experiences that will provide you with the confidence to delve into your next adventure</span></span><b><span> </span></b></p></li></ul></div></div><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p><b><span>How We Get Things Done…</span></b></p><p></p><p><span>This last bit is probably the most important! Here at WBD, our guiding principles are the core values by which we operate and are central to how we get things done. You can find them at </span><a href="http://www.wbd.com/guiding-principles/" target="_blank"><span><span><span><span><span><span><span><span><span><span><span><span><span><span><span><span><span>www.wbd.com/guiding-principles/</span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></a><span> along with some insights from the team on what they mean and how they show up in their day to day. We hope they resonate with you and look forward to discussing them during your interview.</span></p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:left"><b><span>Championing Inclusion at WBD</span></b></p>Warner Bros. Discovery embraces the opportunity to build a workforce that reflects a wide array of perspectives, backgrounds and experiences. Being an equal opportunity employer means that we take seriously our responsibility to consider qualified candidates on the basis of merit, without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, mental or physical disability, and genetic information, marital status, citizenship status, military status, protected veteran status or any other category protected by law.<p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:left"><span>If you’re a qualified candidate with a disability and you require adjustments or accommodations during the job application and/or recruitment process, please visit our </span><a href="https://careers.wbd.com/global/en/accessibility" target="_blank">accessibility page</a><span> for instructions to submit your request.</span></p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p>

Position Summary

Samsung Electronics America, Inc. is now accepting applications for its Summer 2026 Intern Program. This exciting opportunity offers a paid, 10-week experience for selected UNDERGRAD OR GRAD (based on HM request) students. The program will run from June 1 to August 7.

Eligible students will be seniors or recent graduates, possess U.S. work authorization, and be able to work full-time on a 5-day-per-week on-site schedule. Additionally, participation in this program requires that you be located in the United States for the duration of the engagement.

Applications will be reviewed on a rolling basis, so early submission is encouraged. The application window is open until March 15, 2026; however, it may close earlier if all available roles are filled. Applications submitted after the application window or once a role is closed/projects are full will not be considered.

Headquartered in Englewood Cliffs, N.J., Samsung Electronics America, Inc. (SEA), the U.S. Sales and Marketing subsidiary, is a leader in mobile technologies, consumer electronics, home appliances, enterprise solutions and networks systems. For more than four decades, Samsung has driven innovation, economic growth and workforce opportunity across the United States-investing over $100 billion and employing more than 20,000 people nationwide. By integrating our large portfolio of products, services and AI technology, we're creating smarter, sustainable and more connected experiences that empower people to live better. SEA is a wholly owned subsidiary of Samsung Electronics Co., Ltd. To learn more, visit Samsung.com. For the latest news, visit news.samsung.com/us.

Role and Responsibilities

Position Summary

This internship focuses on optimizing profitability through the development and implementation of effective promotional strategies for Samsung's TV, Monitor, and Soundbar products. The intern will work closely with cross-functional teams to analyze historical promotional campaigns, design innovative strategies, and monitor their impact on revenue and profitability. This role offers a unique opportunity to gain hands-on experience in business management, market research, and financial modeling while contributing to the success of Samsung's product categories.

Key Responsibilities

Promotion Analysis:
• Evaluate historical promotional campaigns to identify what has worked best in terms of revenue growth and profitability.
• Assess the impact of promotions on attach rates and customer engagement.

Strategy Development:
• Design and refine promotional strategies tailored to TV, Monitor, and Soundbar products.
• Propose innovative promotional models, such as bundling or subscription-based offers, to increase attach rates.

Financial Modeling:
• Build financial models to assess the potential impact of proposed promotional strategies on revenue and profitability.
• Evaluate the scalability of these strategies across different markets.

Implementation & Monitoring:
• Collaborate with cross-functional teams to execute the developed promotional strategies.
• Monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) to track success and make data-driven adjustments as needed.

General Responsibilities

Market Research and Analysis:
• Conduct in-depth market research to identify emerging trends, customer preferences, and competitive dynamics.
• Analyze existing revenue streams and promotional strategies to pinpoint opportunities for enhancement.

Reporting and Recommendations:
• Prepare detailed reports on the progress and outcomes of the implemented strategies.
• Offer actionable recommendations for continuous improvement and long-term sustainability.

Qualifications

Education:
• Currently pursuing a Master's Degree.
• Preferred academic fields of study: Science, Technology, Engineering, Mathematics
• Final-year graduate students are strongly preferred.

Technical Skills:
• Strong analytical skills with proficiency in data analysis tools (e.g., Excel, Tableau).
• Experience in market research and strategic planning.
• Knowledge of financial modeling and business metrics.
• Excellent communication and presentation skills to effectively convey ideas and findings.

Skills:
• Experience in e-commerce, digital business development, or site management is a plus.
• Technical understanding of e-commerce platforms and integrations.
• Ability to define and report functional requirements for digital features.
• Adaptable and collaborative in a dynamic digital environment.

This internship is based in Englewood Cliffs, New Jersey, and offers a unique opportunity to contribute to Samsung's product categories while gaining valuable experience in category business management, market research, and strategic planning. The intern will have the chance to work on impactful projects, collaborate with experienced professionals, and develop skills that are highly relevant in the field of business management.

Skills and Qualifications

The hourly rate for this role is $49. Actual pay will be determined considering factors such as relevant skills and experience, and comparison to other employees in the role.

Why choose between doing meaningful work and having a fulfilling life? At MITRE, you can have both. That's because MITRE people are committed to tackling our nation's toughest challenges—and we're committed to the long-term well-being of our employees. MITRE is different from most technology companies. We are a not-for-profit corporation chartered to work for the public interest, with no commercial conflicts to influence what we do. The R&D centers we operate for the government create lasting impact in fields as diverse as cybersecurity, healthcare, aviation, defense, and enterprise transformation. We're making a difference every day—working for a safer, healthier, and more secure nation and world. Our workplace reflects our values. We offer competitive benefits, exceptional professional development opportunities for career growth, and a culture of innovation that embraces adaptability, collaboration, technical excellence, and people in partnership. If this sounds like the choice you want to make, then choose MITRE - and make a difference with us.

Department Summary:

This intern position seeks to develop students’ corporate finance and business management knowledge through hands-on assignments across MITRE’s Business Units, within the broader Finance organization. As a Finance intern, you will be challenged to demonstrate financial stewardship while working alongside MITRE leaders to maximize our value to our government sponsors. The variety of tasking and wide scope of this internship will provide a rich set of real-life experiences resulting in a comprehensive understanding of Finance’s critical role in executing MITRE’s mission.

Roles and Responsibilities:
• Prepare and deliver necessary supporting analytics to assist Leadership in decision-making 
• Analyze and diagnose business drivers using various financial systems
• Communicate financial results effectively with powerful visual narratives and story-telling 
• Develop operational and financial projections using various methods including historical trends, statistical analysis, and other predictive techniques 
• Perform Ad hoc analysis for internal and external customers
• Learn, interpret and communicate corporate policy as related to assigned subject areas
• Coordinate activities and information sharing across the Finance Organization

Basic Qualifications:
• Currently enrolled full-time in an accredited degree-seeking program in Finance, Accounting, Business Analytics, Economics, Business Administration or Operations
• Foundational knowledge of core concepts and tools in Accounting, Business Analytics, Economics, Business Administration or Operations
• Proficient in Microsoft Office, including Excel, Word, and PowerPoint \
• Has sustained excellence in academic performance

Preferred Qualifications:
• Exhibits the characteristics of a continuous learner and problem-solver
• Experience having applied Finance, Accounting, Business Analytics, Economics, Business Administration or Operations learning in an internship, related student clubs, and/or other experiences
• Familiarity with data visualization tools (e.g. Tableau, PowerBI)

Are you looking for an exciting job where you can put your skills and talents to work at a company you can feel proud to be a part of? Do you want a workplace that will challenge you and offer you opportunities to learn and grow? A position at Xcel Energy could be just what you’re looking for.

At Xcel Energy, our employees are the driving force behind our success. So we make sure that, here, you can be your best. Doing work that makes a difference for neighbors and communities. Working with a team you can count on to push you. Expanding skills, staying ready for change, and capturing opportunities to grow. All with the support, rewards and recognition you need to thrive – during your internship and beyond.

Project Description

Artificial Intelligence is transforming how work gets done—and Xcel Energy is focused on making sure that transformation delivers real, measurable business value.

We’re looking for an AI Enablement Intern to join a high‑impact team working at the intersection of AI technology, business problem‑solving, and organizational change. This is a cutting‑edge role for someone excited by AI who wants to help shape how it is applied across a large enterprise—not as experimentation, but as a practical driver of productivity and better ways of working.

In this role, you’ll operate much like a business‑facing AI solution architect. You’ll partner with teams across the company to understand how their work actually gets done, identify broken or inefficient processes, and help determine where AI—such as Microsoft Copilot or AI agents—can meaningfully improve outcomes. From there, you’ll help turn those ideas into reality by supporting the thoughtful implementation, adoption, and scaling of AI‑enabled solutions.

At the same time, you’ll contribute to the middle‑out engine that makes AI adoption stick: building community, learning from real wins, and spreading what works so teams can learn from one another. Technology alone doesn’t transform organizations—the combination of the right solutions and the right enablement does. That’s the work this team leads.

This position is for a June 1, 2026 start. The role may have the possibility to extend beyond the internship based on performance and business needs.

What You’ll Work On

This role intentionally blends two dimensions of our AI Enablement strategy:

Top‑Down: AI Solutioning & Business Value

  • Partner with business teams in a consultative manner to understand workflows, pain points, and opportunities for improvement.
  • Help identify where AI is appropriate—and where it isn’t—by mapping real business problems to practical AI solutions.
  • Contribute to the design of AI‑enabled solutions that improve broken or inefficient processes, with a strong focus on value over novelty.
  • Support implementation efforts, recognizing that successful AI adoption requires more than technology—it requires clear communication, change management, and smart rollout approaches.
  • Help assess and communicate impact, including how AI solutions are improving productivity, quality, or the employee experience.

Middle‑Out: Community, Learning & Scale

  • Contribute to building the AI community at Xcel Energy by supporting initiatives like the Copilot Flight Plan, Copilot Champions, and Hero Stories that highlight real success.
  • Help capture and share wins, lessons learned, and best practices so effective AI usage spreads across teams.
  • Support engagement strategies that inspire curiosity, confidence, and responsible use of AI tools.
  • Enable teams to learn from one another by helping package insights, stories, and examples in ways that are easy to reuse and adapt.

You’ll work as part of the AI Enablement team, collaborating internally while also engaging directly with business partners across the organization.

Minimum Requirements

  • Currently enrolled in a bachelor’s or master’s program (as of Fall 2026) in a relevant field (e.g., Business, Information Systems, Engineering, Analytics, Communications, Organizational Development, or similar).
  • Strong curiosity about AI and how it can reshape work—not just from a technology perspective, but from a business and human perspective.
  • Ability to engage with stakeholders, ask good questions, and translate ambiguous problems into clear next steps.
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills; comfortable explaining ideas to both technical and non‑technical audiences.
  • Comfort operating in ambiguity and learning quickly in a fast‑evolving space.
  • Must be a local resident in CO or MN.

Preferred Qualifications

  • Experience working on cross‑functional projects involving technology, process improvement, consulting, or product strategy.
  • Familiarity with modern AI tools (e.g., Microsoft Copilot, automation tools, analytics platforms), or strong interest in learning them quickly.
  • Experience with storytelling, presentations, or content creation that helps spread ideas and best practices.
  • Exposure to change management, adoption strategies, or community‑building efforts.
  • Basic data literacy—comfortable interpreting simple trends or signals to support decision‑making.

Visa sponsorship is not offered for this position.

As a leading combination electricity and natural gas energy company, Xcel Energy offers a comprehensive portfolio of energy-related products and services to 3.4 million electricity and 1.9 million natural gas customers across eight Western and Midwestern states. At Xcel Energy, we strive to be the preferred and trusted provider of the energy our customers need. If you’re ready to be a part of something big, we invite you to join our team.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.

Individuals with a disability who need an accommodation to apply please contact us at recruiting@xcelenergy.com.

Non-Bargaining

The anticipated starting base pay for this position is: $20.40 to $27.20 per hour

This position is eligible for the following benefits: Pension, 401(k) plan, Paid time off (PTO), Holidays

Benefit plans are subject to change and Xcel Energy has the right to end, suspend, or amend any of its plans, at any time, in whole or in part.

In any materials you submit, you may redact or remove age-identifying information including but not limited to dates of school attendance and graduation. You will not be penalized for redacting or removing this information.

Deadline to Apply: 02/11/26

job_title: Work Based Learning - Summer Intern Student
job_description: <strong>Job Requirements </strong><br><p><span style="color: black;">Position Summary</span></p><p> </p><p>High school students on the path to a medical career may apply to enter Spartanburg Regional Health Care System’s Work-Based Learning Summer Internship. These students will work alongside professionals in the healthcare environment to learn foundational skills that can transfer to various healthcare fields. Work-based Learning (WBL) combines classroom-based education with on-the-job training experiences to help students prepare for or explore their work-site objectives. Students selected into this program will have the opportunity to practice critical thinking, problem solving, and communication skills while working alongside highly skilled medical professionals. This experience must be planned and supervised by the school and employer so that it contributes to the student’s education and employability. Orientation into this role will be required.</p><p> </p><p><span style="color: black;">Minimum Requirements </span></p><p> </p><p><strong>Education</strong></p><ul><li>Current Junior or Senior enrolled in a Spartanburg, Cherokee, or Union County High School at time of application</li></ul><p><strong>Experience</strong></p><ul><li>N/A</li></ul><p><strong>License/Registration/Certifications</strong></p><ul><li>N/A</li></ul><p> </p><p><span style="color: black;">Preferred Requirements</span></p><p> </p><p><strong>Preferred Education</strong>      </p><ul><li>N/A</li></ul><p><strong>Preferred Experience</strong>     </p><ul><li>N/A</li></ul><p><strong>Preferred License/Registration/Certifications     </strong></p><ul><li>American Heart BLS Provider Course</li></ul><p><span style="color: black;">Core Job Responsibilities</span></p><p> </p><ul><li>Follows assigned department’s guidelines, roles, and responsibilities</li><li>Identifies areas for improvement and seeks ways to work on self-defined weaknesses</li><li>Remains committed to unit, department, and organization goals</li><li>Adheres to proper chain of command</li><li>Demonstrate exceptional customer service and professionalism in all interactions  </li><li>Assist staff to maintain cleanliness of environment </li><li>Stock and/or organize supplies and equipment  </li><li>Run errands, answer unit telephone, answer and respond to call lights </li><li>Follows Infection Control Procedures </li><li>Other duties as assigned by the department</li></ul><br><br>

<h1><b><b><b>Job Description Summary</b></b></b></h1>Join GE HealthCare as the HR Talent Program Intern and play a pivotal role in shaping the future of our recruitment and hiring processes. <br><br>In this role, you’ll help build talent pipelines and support our national Service Apprentice Program. You’ll work closely with leaders on tasks like reviewing resumes, scheduling interviews, and keeping data organized. You’ll also assist with sending exit surveys and updating trackers to monitor current apprentices and those exiting the program.<br><br>Beyond day-to-day tasks, you’ll have the chance to work on projects such as creating an external partnership tracker or developing training sessions for apprentices to support their ongoing skill development.<p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><h1><b>Job Description</b></h1><p><b>Responsibilities</b></p><ul><li><p>Assist with recruiting and hiring activities, including posting jobs in Workday, reviewing resumes, scheduling interviews, and monitoring pre-employment steps.</p></li><li><p>Keep internal trackers up to date to ensure accurate data for workforce planning and program management.</p></li><li><p>Support coordination of training sessions, monthly calls, and other program events.</p></li><li><p>Assist with sending exit surveys and collecting feedback to improve programs.</p></li><li><p>Help maintain external partnership information and support outreach to schools for local talent pipelines.</p></li><li><p>Collaborate with leaders on program initiatives.</p></li><li><p>Contribute to projects such as creating a partnership tracker or developing training sessions for apprentices.</p></li></ul><p></p><p><b>Required Qualifications</b></p><div><ul><li><p>Currently enrolled in an Associate or Bachelor’s degree program.</p></li><li><p>Strong written and verbal communication skills.</p></li><li><p>Good organizational skills and ability to manage multiple tasks.</p></li><li><p>Proficiency in Microsoft Word and PowerPoint; basic Excel skills for charts and data tables.</p></li><li><p>Comfortable using internet tools and web applications for research and communication.</p></li><li><p><span>Legal authorization to work in the U.S. is required. We will not sponsor individuals for employment visas, now or in the future, for this job.</span></p></li></ul></div><div><p></p><p><b>Desired Characteristics</b></p><ul><li><p>Previous experience in Human Resources: recruitment, learning & development, or program management.</p></li><li><p>Detail-oriented with a process-focused mindset.</p></li><li><p>Familiarity with Workday or other HR systems.</p></li><li><p>Familiarity with Smartsheet.</p></li></ul><p></p><p>For U.S. based positions only, the pay range for this position is $15 - $20 an hour. It is not typical for an individual to be hired at or near the top of the pay range and compensation decisions are dependent on the facts and circumstances of each case. The specific compensation offered to a candidate may be influenced by a variety of factors including skills, qualifications, experience and location. In addition, this position may also be eligible to earn performance-based incentive compensation, which may include cash bonus(es) and/or long term incentives (LTI). GE HealthCare offers a competitive benefits package, including not but limited to medical, dental, vision, paid time off, a 401(k) plan with employee and company contribution opportunities, life, disability, and accident insurance, and tuition reimbursement.​</p><p></p><p>We expect all employees to live and breathe our behaviors: to act with humility and build trust; lead with transparency; deliver with focus, and drive ownership – always with unyielding integrity.</p><p></p><p>Our total rewards are designed to unlock your ambition by giving you the boost and flexibility you need to turn your ideas into world-changing realities. Our salary and benefits are everything you’d expect from an organization with global strength and scale, and you’ll be surrounded by career opportunities in a culture that fosters care, collaboration and support.</p></div><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p>We will not sponsor individuals for employment visas, now or in the future, for this job opening.

<p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><h1><b><b><b>Additional Information</b></b></b></h1><div><div><div><div><div><div><div><p style="text-align:left"><span>GE HealthCare offers a great work environment, professional development, challenging careers, and competitive compensation. GE HealthCare is an </span><a href="https://www.eeoc.gov/sites/default/files/2022-10/22-088_EEOC_KnowYourRights_10_20.pdf" target="_blank">Equal Opportunity Employer</a><span><a href="http://www.ge.com/sites/default/files/15-000845%20EEO%20combined.pdf" target="_blank">.</a> Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.</span></p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p></div></div></div></div></div></div></div><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><div><div><div><div><div><div><div><p style="text-align:left"><span>GE HealthCare will only employ those who are legally authorized to work in the United States for this opening. Any offer of employment is conditioned upon the successful completion of a drug screen (as applicable). </span></p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p></div></div></div></div></div></div></div><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:left">While GE HealthCare does not currently require U.S. employees to be vaccinated against COVID-19, some GE HealthCare customers have vaccination mandates that may apply to certain GE HealthCare employees.</p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><div><div><div><div><div><div><div><p style="text-align:left"><b>Relocation Assistance Provided: </b><span>No</span></p></div></div></div></div></div></div></div><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p>

<p style="text-align: center;"><strong>Accounting Co-op/Intern - Summer 2026</strong></p><p> </p><p>This job description reflects potential openings for the <strong>Summer 2026</strong> <strong>Co-op/Internship</strong> Session (May-August). This is a general job description and represents multiple openings in various departments. <strong>Honda offers both single and multi-semester co-ops and internships. College students must apply to the requisition pertaining to their major and semester of </strong><strong>interest.</strong></p><p><strong>Please note:</strong><strong> </strong>Sponsorship for employment visa status for these positions is unavailable. Applicants requiring sponsorship for employment visa status now or in the future (e.g., F-1 CPT/OPT, H-1B, TN, etc.) will not be considered.</p><p> </p><p style="text-align: center;"><strong>More about the Accounting/Finance Co-op/ Intern at Honda</strong></p><p> </p><p>The below descriptions reflect <em>potential</em> environments and duties within our various Accounting/ Finance Co-op/ Intern positions that we offer. Work environments and projects may include but are not limited to:</p><p><span style="-webkit-tap-highlight-color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0); text-size-adjust: none; text-decoration: underline;">North American Strategy and Planning</span><span style="-webkit-tap-highlight-color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0); text-size-adjust: none;">:</span></p><ul><li>Co-op's will have the opportunity to work within a general ledger group and perform analysis on balance sheet accounts, improve reconciliation techniques and see the compilation of the financial statements. (Ohio only)</li></ul><p> </p><p> </p><p style="text-align: center;"><strong>What you need to be successful in this role</strong></p><p> </p><p><span style="-webkit-tap-highlight-color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0); text-size-adjust: none; text-decoration: underline;">Required</span>:</p><ul type="disc"><li>Legally authorized to work in the U.S. without sponsorship</li><li>General Business Coursework</li><li>Minimum 2.5 Cumulative GPA or higher (You will be required to provide your current transcript)</li><li>Class status- Sophomore (by credit hour) or above</li><li>Availability to work a minimum of 10 weeks at 40 hours per week</li><li>Enrollment in a Bachelor's or Master's degree program studying studying Accounting or related field</li><li>Valid U.S. Driver's License (exceptions considered on a case-by-case basis)</li><li>Ability to secure own transportation to and from work each day<ul type="circle"><li><em>*Public transportation and ride share services are limited in some of our locations. Co-ops are responsible for securing their own transportation to and from work each day, and must have a reliable plan for transportation in order to be eligible for a position.</em><em> Regular in-person attendance is required, and transportation issues will not be excused.</em></li></ul></li></ul><p><span style="-webkit-tap-highlight-color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0); text-size-adjust: none; text-decoration: underline;">Desired</span>:</p><ul><li>Accounting specific coursework</li><li>General understanding of the manufacturing environment</li></ul><p> </p><p style="text-align: center;"><strong>Position Locations</strong></p><p> </p><p>Accounting Co-op/ Intern positions are offered in the cities/ states listed below, if you are selected to move forward in the process, you will be given the opportunity to make selections on your location preferences:</p><ul><li>Marysville, Ohio (45 minutes northwest of Columbus, Ohio)</li><li>Raymond, Ohio (45 minutes northwest of Columbus, Ohio)</li><li>Torrance, California (30 minutes south of Downtown Los Angeles, California) </li><li>Timmonsville, South Carolina (20 minutes southwest of Florence, South Carolina) </li></ul><p> </p><p style="text-align: center;"><strong>Honda Co-operative and Learning Internships Program Benefits</strong></p><p> </p><p><strong>Housing Accommodations:</strong> Honda offers housing at a shared cost or a housing stipend <em>based on location</em> for our Co-ops and Interns. It is not required to opt-in to, but is available should you need housing at the time of your Co-op/ Internship with Honda.</p><p><strong>Honda Business Resource Groups:</strong> One of the ways Honda gives diversity a voice is through its business resource groups. The associate-led, company-supported groups have members aligned across different dimensions of diversity such as gender, ethnicity, ability, life stage and experiences. The groups provide networking opportunities, a chance to give back and professional development. Some groups have even given feedback on Honda products, making them more appealing to all. Embracing all views is what will drive us into the future. Honda wants passionate, driven people to be a part of that future.</p><p><strong>Performance Feedback: </strong>Honda Co-ops and Interns will have the opportunity to receive informal and formal feedback from their leaders, ask questions and express future interest in a scheduled mid-term and final evaluation.</p><p><strong>Mentorship:</strong> Each Co-op/ Intern is assigned a mentor in your department to help you navigate your time at Honda.</p><p><strong>On-site Wellness Center: </strong>Co-ops and Interns have access to join our Wellness Centers (varies by location). Our Wellness Centers are full gyms equipped with cardio machines, weights, basketball courts, pools, dieticians, personal trainers and group fitness classes.</p><p><strong>Paid overtime: </strong>Co-ops and Interns will receive 1.5 times their hourly rate of pay for any overtime worked.</p><p><strong>Consideration for full time employment: </strong>Our Cooperative Learning Internships program is utilized as a talent pipeline for our full time positions!</p><p><strong>Hourly Wage Range: $23.35-$30.21</strong></p><p><em><strong>Pay will be based on several variables that include, but not limited to, geographic location, work experience, education, etc.</strong></em></p><p><em>Additional details regarding Honda Co-op and Intern benefits are provided upon offer.</em></p>
